alert.note: Alert for Spencer; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 01 at 3:02AM EDT until July 01 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR WARRICK AND CENTRAL SPENCER COUNTIES... At 201 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lynnville to near Boonville to near Newburgh, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. This storm has produced multiple reports of wind gusts up to 70 mph! IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Folsomville around 205 AM CDT. Dale around 220 AM CDT. Rockport and Santa Claus around 230 AM CDT. Grandview around 235 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Tennyson, Gentryville and Chrisney. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana near Mile Marker 7. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 40 and 55. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
